page.title: 11Transport in Uzmaston area
page.content: Ten passenger trains leave the Rail- -way Station each weekday, two being 125 High Speed trains to London, the rest terminating at Swansea. Another ten, of which one is from London pass through to Milford. There are two Royal Mail trains a day, 25 oil trains a week, also goods trains carrying fertilizers, steel and explosives. Haverfordwest has 68 railway employees About 120 tickets a day are sold, Swansea and Carmarthen being the most popular destinations, six people travel daily to work at these towns, and Saturday is the busiest day, particularly between Haverfordwest and Milford. The A40 Road is the direct link with the A48 and M4 to London and container lorries travel this route to Fishguard and Ireland. Uzmaston has no local bus but a minibus takes village children to school, others use cars.
